Dear Ms. Prusa:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.

ALLEGATION:
Resident A alleges staff person 1 engaged in a physical altercation with her.
INVESTIGATION:
Resident A states she broke the rules on 05/28/2019 by taking her make up bag to
her bedroom. Resident A states staff person 2 asked for the make up bag and she
would have handed it to her, but staff person 1 reached over to grab the make up
bag from the window ledge. Resident A states she “punched” staff person 1 in the
mouth and hit staff person 1 multiple times. Resident A states staff person 1 hit
resident A on the right side of her forehead. Resident A states there was no swelling
or bruising from this contact. This consultant did not observe any swelling or bruising
on resident A’s forehead. Resident A states she kicked staff person 1 and staff
person 1 pinched the area above the back of resident A’s right heel. Resident A
showed this consultant the area above the back of her right ankle and there was no
swelling or bruising observed. Resident A states staff person 2 secured resident A’s
arms and directed resident A to calm down and for staff person 1 to leave. Resident
2

A states this is the only physical altercation she has had with staff person 1 and has
not had any other physical altercation with staff. Resident A states she feels safe at
Mott Children Center.
Staff person 1 states resident A was upset that she was directed to put her make up
in the storage cubby. Staff person 1 states resident A said, “not taking my shit” and
took her make up bag to her bedroom. Staff person 1 states resident A was
redirected to bring her make up back up front and when resident A did not comply
staff person 1 and 2 went to resident A’s bedroom. Staff person 1 states she
reached for resident A’s make up bag on the window ledge and resident A used her
fist and hit staff person 1 in the face. Staff person 1 states she grabbed resident A’s
arm to stop resident A from swinging and pushed resident A on to the bed. Staff
person 1 states she did not strike resident A. Staff person 1 states staff person 2
secured resident A and staff person 1 left the room. Staff person 1 states resident A
was not injured, but staff person 1 received a scratch on her stomach and lost an
earring.
Staff person 2 states resident A packed up her make up and took it to her bedroom
instead of placing it in her cubby located upfront on the unit. Staff person 1 states
staff person 1 and 2 walked down to resident A’s bedroom because resident A had
glass make up bottles. Staff person 2 states staff person 1 reached for the make up
bag on the window ledge and resident A hit staff person 1 in the face. Staff person 2
states resident A had stated “take my shit and I’m gonna swing.” Staff person 2
states staff person 1 put her hands up reflexively and it hit resident A in the chest
area and then pushed resident A on to the bed. Staff person 2 states resident A hit
staff person 1 multiple times. Staff person 2 states she wrapped her arms around
resident A and directed staff person 1 to leave the bedroom. Staff person 2 states
resident A calmed down and she talked with resident A. Staff person 2 states she
did not observe any injuries to resident A or staff person 1. Staff person 2 wrote an
incident report that matches her interview statements.
Resident A was seen by two Whaley Children Center – Mott Children Residence
nurses on 05/29/2019. Each nurse wrote that resident A was observed with a dry,
discolored area on her right posterior ankle and a faded bruise on her right upper
arm.
Staff person 1 and 2’s personnel files were reviewed. Both are current in
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention and do not have any disciplinary action regarding
physical management.
There is no video tape available for review because the incident occurred in resident
A’s bedroom and the bedrooms are not equipped with cameras.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe discipline,
including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any manner.
ANALYSIS: Resident A had glass make up bottles in her make up bag and
took the make up bag to her bedroom instead of putting it in her
cubby upfront on the unit. Staff person 1 and 2 entered resident
A’s room and staff person 2 reached for the make up bag on the
window ledge. This prompted resident A to hit staff person 1 in
the face. Staff person 1 states she did not hit resident A, but
grabbed resident A’s arms and pushed resident A on to the bed.
Staff person 2 states staff person 1 put her hands up reflexively
and it hit resident A in the upper chest area and pushed resident
A on to the bed.
This consultant finds after being hit by resident A, staff person 1
did not attempt to re-direct resident A, or request staff person 2
to help with a two person hold. Instead staff person 1 grabbed
resident A’s arms and pushed resident A on to the bed.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
CONSULTATION:
This consultant recommends Mott Children Residence administration consider
establishing policy and procedure of keeping resident bedroom doors locked during
waking hours.
